section.title: Introduction
section.para: The following elements give an overview what currently can be transformed from Enterprise Architect (EA) to Eclipse Modeling Framework (EMF)-UML.

listitem.para: Class diagram: Class, Component, Port, Enumeration, Interface
Activity diagram: Activity, DecisionNode, ForkNode, InitialNode, FlowFinalNode, JoinNode, MergeNode
Connector, Association, InformationFlow, Generalization, ControlFlow, Dependency

variablelist.para: Stereotypes are also implemented as long as there is a given Profile for that. Creating the profile from the model is not supported yet.

listitem.para: Basic understanding of how a EA-model is transformed into an EMF-model.
As usual we will use UML as modeling language, so a basic understanding is preferable
Some modeling experience in EA is adviced.

section.title: Configuration
section.para: The following components are needed to transform an EA to an EMF-UML model.

section.title: RepositoryReader
section.para: The RepositoryReader is a WorkflowComponent, that reads an EA model file.
To add the RepositoryReader to your workflow put <component class="org.genesez.adapter.ea.RepositoryReader" /> to your workflow file.
The parameters below have to be defined in the workflow file.

listitem.para: The file that should be read.
The slot where the model will be stored and loaded for the serialization.
The name of the model in EA file.

section.title: ProfileReader
section.para: The ProfileReader is a WorkflowComponent, that reads profiles for the EA model.
To add the ProfileReader to your workflow put <component class="org.genesez.adapter.ea.ProfileReader" /> to your workflow file.
The parameters below have to be defined in the workflow file.

listitem.para: The extension the profiles end with.
The directory name where profiles are located.
The name of the profile to apply to the model.

section.title: Model2UML
section.para: The Model2UML is a WorkflowComponent, that converts the serialized model to EMF-UML.
To add the Model2UML to your workflow put <component class="org.genesez.adapter.ea.Model2UML" /> to your workflow file.
The parameters below have to be defined in the workflow file.

listitem.para: The input slot for the serialized EA model.
The output slot name for the transformed serialized EMF-UML model.

section.title: XmiWriter
section.para: The XmiWriter is a WorkflowComponent, that writes the transformed model to a file.
To add the XmiWriter to your workflow put <component class="org.genesez.adapter.ea.XmiWriter" /> to your workflow file.
The parameters below have to be defined in the workflow file.

listitem.para: The input slot for the transformed serialized EMF-UML model.
The name of the XMI output file.
The name to find the transformed resource internally. Currently the name doesn't matter, but it must be defined something.
